text:
I have FancyIndexing enabled in apache2.conf.  When I use "IndexOptions
+SuppressDescription" in an .htaccess file, FancyIndexing becomes disabled.  In
other words, with no .htaccess file I get fancy indexing, with "IndexOptions
+SuppressDescription" I don't, and with "IndexOptions +SuppressDescription
+FancyIndexing" I do.

From my understanding, using a + option should not disable other index options.
 This situation worked as expected in apache 1.x.
creator: jvb@prairienet.org
nd@perlig.de
text:
Hmm, works for me like a charm (2.0.48-dev).

more or less Defaultconfig, plus .htaccess file containing just Indexoptions
+SuppressDescription.

It looks more like you've disabled fancyindexing somewhere. Can you provide
minimal config which doesn't work as expected for you?

Thanks.

> It looks more like you've disabled fancyindexing somewhere.

That doesn't follow.  As I said, when I have no .htaccess at all, I get fancy
indexing.  From there, adding an .htaccess containing the single line
"IndexOptions +SuppressDescription" certainly should not disable fancy indexing.

I think it was a bit rash to close this bug.  It may be something subtle that is
a side effect of another setting.

I might be able to provide a minimal config, but that would take time (the
server is running three virtual domains so there is a lot to factor out), and
I'm not sure you are taking me seriously.
